properties.descrip: Entire stretch of cycle lane on the Link Rd in dire need of resurfacing. Red tarmac chipping away and causing danger of trips or falls. Reported to council previously but no action taken. Cycle lane should ideally be raised or segregated from roadway to prevent cars driving on the surface & wearing it down faster.
Just at the start of the cycle lane is a very uneven surface, forcing the cyclist to move into traffic and a potentially dangerous moment in the junction.

Very uneven surface citybound which necessitates either cycling close to driveways or near the centre of the road. Has been like this for a long time. I haven't cycled along here since March however I am not aware that it has been fixed.
Very uneven surface travelling north on Grand Parade just before the lights.
There is some sort of concrete like material that looks like it has been spilled in the cycle lane and created a very uneven surface.
Lots of gravel build up at the left turn in the junction from Anderson's Quay on to Clontarf Street - makes a very hazardous turning that could result in a cyclist slipping/falling.

Encroaching overhanging hedges hanging out over garden walls onto the road are pushing eastbound cyclists out into the middle of the traffic lane on Glasheen road between School Avenue and Tara lawn. (there is no footpath on this section, so overanging garden hedges narrow the road lane)

In the north bound lane, the road has been recently resurfaced. There is a draining grid at the side of the road that is now approximately 10 cm below the road surface creating a very dangerous 'pot hole'.
Very large pothole in the bus lane.
Manhole cover is about 5 cm below the road surface, which sits in a metal frame. This is a very significant obstacle for cyclist and could easy cause a fall.
Very narrow down sloping hill with narrow bridge. Absolutely dangerous Hazard for both Cyclist and Motorist.
Narrow bridge on Ballyheada road in the Ballinhassig village

Bikes travelling on the street when pedestrian in in force, then late afternoon contra-flow bikes going the wrong way down to Parnell Place, dangerous 'Deliveroo' bikes at all times, it's a pedestrians nightmare to walk the street.
In Southbound lane, entering the roundabout, there is a big lump of tarmac that could easily cause a cyclist to fall if they hit it.
Big pothole in northbound lane.

Two deep potholes as a result of subsidence which are getting deeper every day.
Earmarked for repair in 6/8 weeks acccording to the council.
Very uneven surface with cracks and fissures on both sides of the road
Unprotected cycle lane along Tramore Road very worn and poorly marked in parts. Resurfacing and repainting needed, with segregation added if possible.
Broken surface and deep potholes along side of rad, forcing cyclists into middle of busy/fast traffic lane.
Sunken section of road with raised edges. It's like cycling over train tracks
Pothole at side of road, cyclists who don't command the lane find themselves moving into the lane at a point where the road narrows and motorist are overtaking them

Large sunken cover. Avoidance of this uneven surface forces cyclists out into the lane where the road narrows. Motorists overtaking at this point may not take this into account or the two roads that join Curragh road which may lead them to come into contact with the cyclist
Dangerous dip in the shoulder leading northbound on R600. Cyclist recently had severe fall and was almost run over by trailing car after the dip forced a crash.
Cycle lane on Harbour View not usable due to poor surface and debris

Cars turning in to the Merchant's Quay carpark are often unsighted as they turn to the carpark from Parnell Place. It is extremely dangerous for cyclists un aware of a car suddenly cutting across them. A sign must be erected warning cars intending to turn to carpark that they are crossing a cycle track.
Combination of pothole and uneven surface on the city bound lane at the main entrance to St. Finbarrs Hospital. Works uncompleted after services works.
